dialogues.text: Nobody knows anything. THROUGH BINOCULARS: as DINO is HEARD HANGING UP, Eddie reacts, picks up his phone and throws it across the offic Welles sits back, trying to accept the realization that h found them.  He looks to the PHOTO of the Third Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is you, isn't it, Eddie? Welles goes to the RECORDER, turns on the TONE DECODER. LED window LIGHTS UP.  Welles hits STOP, REWIND, PLAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and your pals, you're fucked... Hits FAST FORWARD... hits PLAY, watching the TONE DECODER From the RECORDER, the SOUND of EDDIE DIALING a NUMBER on his touch tone phone... and as EACH TONE is HEARD, a corresponding NUMBER appears on the DECODER'S LED readout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recorder continues, REPLAYING the CONVERSATION betwee Eddie and Dino, while Welles studies the green LED digits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two one two.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The brilliant lights of New York's peerless skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Welles' Ford as it moves along with traffic, cross the 59th Street Bridge, into the heart of Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: "Chase Manhattan Bank," mid-town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles puts the 8MM FILM into SAFE DEPOSIT DRAWER, shuts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy and crowded, but quiet.  Welles places a massive tom down on a table:  "Haines Criss-Cross Directory." Welles sits, takes out his notepad, referring to the phon number written: "(212) 555-9906."  He opens the reference book, searching pages... Thousands of TELEPHONE NUMBERS are LISTED in SEQUENCE, ea with an address.  Welles runs his finger down the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEDESTRIANS everywhere.  Streets are clogged with DELIVER TRUCKS loading and unloading.  Cars horns blow.  Welles walks to an old, WAREHOUSE BUILDING shoulder to shoulder with other buildings, labeled "1204" in burnished steel. Welles climbs the stairs, examines the buzzers. The top button's labeled "Greystone Imports," the bottom button reads "Lang Interior Design, by appt."  The middle button is labeled only by a drawing of a BLACK WIDOW SPID Welles looks up at the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low.  Less activity on the street.  Welles lea against a car down the street, smoking a cigarette. TWO WOMEN walk this way, both in spiked high heels, dress in cheap, short, formfitting skirts, both carrying duffel bags.  They start up the stairs of 1204... Welles throws his cigarette, walks to follow. The women hit the center button.  A BUZZER sounds as they head inside.  Welles hurries up the stairs, catching the door before it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles follows the women into a decrepit ELEVATOR.  One woman hits "2."  Welles hits "3," steps back in the corne Elevator doors creak closed.  The two women are heavily m up, pretty, but worn, eyes dull. Welles looks down at the leg of one woman, noticing bruis through her fishnet stockings, poorly covered by make-up. Elevator doors open on the SECOND FLOOR.  The two women g out and walk down a grey hallway, towards DOUBLE DOORS painted black.  Welles stops the elevator door from closi The women push the INTERCOM at the black doors.  Another dull BUZZ is HEARD as the women enter.  The low rumble of HEAVY METAL MUSIC is HEARD, SILENCED as doors swing shut. Welles lets the elevator close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens on the FIRST FLOOR.  Welles gets out, instead of leaving the way he came, heads towards the rear... FOLLOW him down a hallway, past a SERVICE ELEVATO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles comes out BACK DOORS into an sunless alleyway with fire escapes above.  There's a TRASH DUMPSTER, overflowin Rats scatter upon Welles, arrival. Welles looks to make sure he's alone.  He starts tearing open GARBAGE BAGS.  Flies swarm.  One bag's filled with empty food containers and old newspapers. Welles tears open another bag, finds burnt out FLORESCENT LIGHTBULBS, digs out a handful of empty PHOTO PAPER PACKAGES, bottles of DEVELOPING CHEMICALS.  He pulls out few MAGAZINES; Time, Newsweek, etc... The magazines are cut up, falling apart, with pictures chopped out from many pages.  Welles examines ADDRESS LAB "Dino Velvet/D.V. Films 1204 Keller Street New York, NY 10049"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles is on the PHONE.  The city bustles past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about a guy called Dino Velvet?  Dino Velvet Films?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is on the phone by the register, ringing purchases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dino Velvet... yeah, he's like the John Luc Godard of S+M flicks, supposed to be a real weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weirdo making S+M films?  Who'd have thought it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His stuff comes out of New York. Bondage and fetish videos, Gothic Hardcore.  Definitely not for the squeamish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specialty product.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're learning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he sell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the back of bondage magazines mostly, but you can find it on the street if you look.  He'll also do commissions, for enough money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing illegal, it's always borderline.  Like if some freak wants to see a transvestite in a full rubber immersion suit getting an enema from a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I get the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts all kinds of other stuff into his movies; photographs, newsreel footage, subliminal images. Thinks he's making art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm in New York now.  What do you say to flying out and giving me a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a working stiff, pops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a vacation.  I'll pay you four hundred a day, plus expenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to come out there and play private eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it.  Meanwhile, dig up whatever Dino Velvet films you can. Get receipts.  I'll call back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya. Welles hangs up, starts feeding quarters into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Christian's in bed, pale and sickly.  The PHONE RING Mrs. Christian reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Christian, Tom Welles here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?  Having any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if luck's the word. Are you feeling alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been ordered into bed.  The doctor says I've gotten the flu, or some other wretched ailment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing more than a bother.  Have you any news for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made progress.  I'm in Manhattan.  Once a few more pieces fall into place, I'll drive to you and give you an update.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... MRS. CHRISTIAN is HEARD COUGHING.  Welles waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got about five thousand left in cash, but I'll need another thirty, if you approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I get it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a pencil and paper, I'll tell you how to send it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI pulls over in front of this flea-bag motel.  Max g out with a SUITCASE, looks at the dubious accommodations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters with Welles, turns on a light and throws his suitcase on the bed.  The room is disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say it was gonna be this luxurious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's their Presidential Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Max looks in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, man, what are we doing in this flea bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cheap, and people know to mind their own business. What have you got for me?  Max opens his suitcase, takes out THREE VIDEO TAPES. He hands them to Welles.  The boxes are covered in jumble PHOTO COLLAGES: American flag, S+M men and women, a skull mannequins, a scorpion, cut-outs of arms, legs and eyebal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dino Velvet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles is lit by the flicker from the TELEVISION SCREEN. SEE NOTHING.  We HEAR the rhythmic MUFFLED MOANS of a WOM from the TV, can't tell if it's pleasure or pain. Max is asleep in the bed, PIZZA BOX near his feet. Welles drinks beer, gets up and ejects the CASSETTE from VCR, tosses it aside, tired.  He picks another Dino Velve TAPE, puts it in, sits. ON TV: GOTHIC ROCK is HEARD over old, scratchy IMAGES: of Klansmen around a burning cross... Dracula menacing a sleeping woman... a man in a Devil costume dancing... Welles opens another beer. ON TV: a WOMAN is tied up, arms in the air, hanging from ceiling, gagged and blindfolded, in a dungeon lit by candelabras.  Then, glimpsed IMAGES: worms writhing in slime... gargoyles... a guillotine falling.  Then, the bo woman, struggling.  A MASKED MAN in a leather jacket ente He wears a LEATHER MASK with zipper eyes and mouth... This focuses Welles' attention. ON TV: the Masked Man circles the captured woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max... wake up... Max awakens, rolling over, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this, in the mask?  Who is he? Max tries to see, eyes barely open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's one of the lunatics Dino uses. He's in a bunch of these. Welles watches.  On the TV, Masked Man takes off his jack shirtless, reveals an impossibly muscled body.  Huge arms thick chest, oiled, dotted in pimples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  He have something to do with whatever you're into? Still watching the behemoth on TV, Welles is less sure. ON TV: the bulging Masked Man flexes, ripped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's nothing... that's not him. Welles rubs his eyes, sits back.  Max sits up, watching. ON TV: Masked Man pulls the bound woman's head back by he hair, licks her face with his thick tongue... CLOSE ON: Masked Man grips the woman's head, still lickin He pulls down the woman's blindfold... Welles sits forward, realizing, horrified... Welles goes to the VCR, hits PAUSE.  The IMAGE on TV FREEZES.  Welles goes back, FRAME by FRAME... ... to the CLOSE UP where Masked Man grips the woman's fa FREEZE FRAME.  On Masked Man's hand: a TATTOO, on the arc between his forefinger and thumb, same as the scrawny Mas Man in the snuff film.  A PENTAGRAM TATTOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, he's one of Dino Velvet's stock players...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he, his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows his name.  That's his thing.  He always wears a mask.  You never see his face.  He calls himself "Machine," that's what they call him.  Machine.  Welles hits PLAY.  On TV, Masked Man runs his hands up an down the woman's body.  The woman's eyes are filled with fear.  Welles sits, unnerved, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say he's half brain-dead from all the steroids he's using. Max rolls over, trying to get back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a brutal motherfucker, man.  He loves what he does for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles enters, carries an OVERNIGHT PACKAGE and his LOCK BOX.  At the desk, he tears open the package, opens the MANILA ENVELOPE inside; finds FIFTY THOUSAND DOLLARS in thousand dollar bills, wrapped in plastic and masking tap Welles takes the lock box to the bed and works the combination, opens it.  He takes out the holster, stands looking down at the gun.  He puts the holster on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' Ford waits with turn signal on.  A car pulls out a parking space.  Welles takes the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is in the passenger seat.  Welles looks to 1204.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of Junior P.I. would I be if I didn't go with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles and Max get off the elevator, moving down the grey hall, to the black doors.  Welles pushes the INTERCOM BUTTON.  After a moment, the INTERCOM CRACKLES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Welles waits, presses the button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors BUZZ and Welles and Max warily enter this large dark, converted warehouse.  Square pillars shoot from flo to ceiling.  Shafts of light cut down from high windows. A large THUG in a pinstripe suit crosses from a far DESK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for Mr. Velvet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.  Welles looks around, at piles of PROPS; a huge faux-stone ANGEL and GARGOYLES, elaborate CANDELABRAS, a huge BIRDCA massive WOODEN CROSS, NAZI FLAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell him we're here to give him a large sum of money.  If he's not interested, we'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should leave now, before I have to remove you. Welles just stands looking at the thug.  A VOICE is HEARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from SPEAKERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show them in, Milo. Welles and Max look up.  There are SPEAKERS mounted high on the pillars, and SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the boss, Milo. The disgruntled thug starts back across the studio toward a distant DOOR.  Welles and Max follow... They notice an elaborate set built in one corner, a TORTU CHAMBER, complete with RACK and IRON MAIDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug opens the door and lets Welles and Max in. The office is huge, windowless walls covered in thousands PICTURES from every conceivable source, torn and cut, pin up to form an indecipherable collage.  A tall LADDER lean against one wall, near three TELEVISIONS. DINO VELVET rises behind his desk, a small, bird-like man wearing a black suit and bad hairpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.  Make yourself comfortable. Welles shakes Dino's hand.  Max looks up at the walls. IMAGES; porn pictures, news photos, world leaders, autops photos, armies and insects, the naked and the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an honor to meet you.  Thank you for seeing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you today? Welles sits.  Shelves behind Dino's desk are piled high w VIDEO CASSETTES, old MOVIE CAMERAS, big REELS of 16mm FIL VIDEOS and MAGAZINES are stacked everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to commission a work.  I'm a great admirer of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flattering.  And, who's your colorful little chum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fellow investor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one still shooting film and transferring it to video. Nobody appreciates that kind of integrity anymore... the grain, the gritty look you get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you appreciate it. (to Welles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say is your favorite piece? Welles considers.  Max glances over, looks back to the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know if I had to pick, it'd be "Choke," or "Devil."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Devil" frightened me as much as it excited me, but I'd be hard pressed to choose a favorite. Dino grins, showing yellowed teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something about money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  What we're looking for is rather specific. Welles takes out an ENVELOPE, puts it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand now, five thousand on delivery.  Two women, one white and one black, as long as they have large breasts. Hard bondage, or course.  Other than that, trusting your artistic interpretation, I have only two stipulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to watch you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll consider it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other performer... it has to be that monster you use... the man in the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not him, there's no deal. Dino drums his painted fingernails on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be interested... but it would mean another five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, I'll have to put my thinking-cap on about all this. You'll leave the money as a deposit? (off Welles' nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Dino stands, picks up a still CAMERA off his desk and com to look at Welles, studying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a beautiful face... the way the light hits it.  I'd like to take your picture.  You don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm camera shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me to keep your money, but not to take your picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are two different kinds of trust. (stands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time.  I hope we can do business. Welles leaves.  Max goes with him.  Dino watches them lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORNS BLARE.  TWO CARS have collided head-on.  A large CR gathers.  One windshield's shattered, blood spattered.  T driver is slumped over the wheel, gushing blood. On a nearby street corner, Welles in on a PAY PHONE. HEAVY METAL can be HEARD filtered through the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dino's stands in the middle of his office, naked, his bac to us, 8MM camera in hand, on the phone.  A NAKED WOMAN dances for Dino.  A Heavy Metal MUSIC VIDEO plays on a TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do this for you.  Fifteen thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine's in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in.  It will be his pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be at 366 Hoyt Avenue, three o'clock, tomorrow. Welles digs out his notepad, writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooklyn.  Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORNS and TRAFFIC are HEARD.  Max and Welles sit in lawn chairs at the tiny pool.  Welles smokes.  Max drinks beer They watch an ELDERLY WOMAN in a one piece bathing suit climb from the pool and walk to the diving board, diving

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to figure that out myself.  I have to see Machine without his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still don't want to tell me what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. The old woman climbs out and heads back to the diving boa Welles takes out a thick ENVELOPE, hands it to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you. Max doesn't understand, opens the envelope, finds about fifteen thousand dollars in the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's money.  People use it to purchase goods and services. Max looks at it again, can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... that's awful generous and everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my money.  The woman I got it from is never going to give it a second thought.  Let's not make a big deal out of this, okay?  (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go be a race car driver.  Go run for President.  Whatever. Welles puts his cigarette out, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you around. Welles walks away, heading to his room.  Max watches him doesn't know what to say, looks in the envelope. The old woman climbs out and heads back to the diving boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted, war zone neighborhood of abandoned, graffitti buildings.  A few burnt out cars on the street.  Welles drives through, watchful. Welles drives past a huge TWO-STORY WAREHOUSE, does a u-t He parks the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles checks his gun, returns it to his holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles climbs crumbling concrete stairs, looking all directions, crossing a LOADING DOCK towards a DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles enters slowly, trying to get his eyes to adjust to the darkness.  A vast, empty space looms before him. In the middle of the warehouse, Dino Velvet stands, in a powder blue suit, holding an archery BOW and ARROW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.  Come join us. There's a wrought IRON BED not far from Dino.  MACHINE is seated on the mattress, a huge man, wearing a leather S+M harness and the same WRESTLING MASK as in the snuff film. Welles gathers his courage, walks towards them. Dino pulls back on the bow, aiming away across the warehouse.  He stands by a TABLE with a QUIVER of ARROWS propped up.  He shoots an arrow toward a large TARGET... Strikes the target dead center, BULL'S-EYE.  As Welles ge closer, he notices several things ...  ... a 16MM CAMERA mounted on a TRIPOD, facing the bed, al with several movie LIGHTS ... several BOWIE KNIFES are laid out on the table, besid a pair of HANDCUFFS... ... Machine is watching him as he approaches... Welles stops, not far from Dino and Machine, but keeping distance.  Dino's still firing arrows at the target. Machine's still staring at Welles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Machine just stares at him with bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes out envelope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Dino lets fly another arrow... another bull's-eye, then turns to look at Welles with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should be here any minute. Welles comes forward slowly, places the envelope on the table, beside Bowie knifes.  He's sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the knifes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?  Oh, the knifes?  They're just props.  Nice, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Dino walks across towards the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine and I were just talking about knifes.  The beauty of knifes... Dino pulls arrows from the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was saying how fascinated he is by their simple ability to be sharp. The ability of a piece of metal to be so thin that it is almost nothing... Dino walks back to the table, replaces the arrows in the quiver, cueing another arrow in is bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So close to nothingness that it cuts with minimum effort, because it's so non-intrusive.  Flesh is fooled.  It blooms open as the blade widens, but by then it's too late, because the knife's already doing its pure, simple damage. Dino shoots another arrow to the target. A CLATTER attracts Welles attention.  Far across the warehouse, a DELIVERY DOOR rolls upwards.  A CAR with tin windows drives in... The MAN who opened the door, silhouetted in sunlight, sta behind to close the door as the car pulls forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ours guests have arrived. Machine stands.  He is a giant. Welles takes a few steps back, wary, sweating hard now. The car parks across the warehouse, not far from the targ Dino puts another arrow in his bow, pulls it taunt, aims the target... turns, aims the arrow at Welles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Welles... would you be so kind as to remove any firearms from your person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out your gun! Welles brings his hand towards his holster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly.  Let me see it. Welles takes out his gun, looks across the warehouse... The SILHOUETTED MAN is walking this way.  Can't tell who is yet.  Machine heads the direction of the parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty the gun onto the table, very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, cunt!  Do exactly as I say, or I'll put this arrow through your throat. Welles obeys, helpless, dumps the bullets out on the tabl The SILHOUETTED MAN'S getting closer.  It's Eddie Poole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Welles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the gun down, take the handcuffs.  Handcuff yourself to the bed. Welles obeys, walks to the bed. Welles attaches one cuff to the bed's iron rail, fastens other cuff around his wrist. Dino puts down the bow and a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to Welles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know what to make of you at first, and you certainly had Eddie on pins and needles.  But, lo and behold, from out of the blue came an old business acquaintance to explain everything... Welles looks across to the car... The sinister lawyer, Longdale, gets out from behind the wheel and hands the keys to Machine, walks this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the fucker?  Motherfucker, doesn't look like anything... Eddie walks around the bed, studies Welles.  Welles watch him.  Eddie goes to stand behind Welles, rushes forward.. PUNCHES Welles in the side of the head. Welles goes down, clutching his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like shit. Eddie pulls Welles to his feet, throws him against the be frisking him from head to toe. Longdale comes to stand beside Dino, nervous, taking out tiny HANDGUN and pointing it at Welles.  Welles looks up, holding his head, afraid, sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Welles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Mr. Longdale, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine idea. Dino comes to sit on the bed beside Welles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to go get the film you received from Mrs. Christian, bring it here and put it in my hand.  And to save time, so we make this as efficient as possible, there's an incentive... Dino puts his fingers in his mouth, lets out a sharp WHIS Across the warehouse, Machine uses the car keys to open t trunk of the car, pulls SOMEONE out... It's Max, beaten bloody, bound, face swollen, gagged, har conscious.  Machine throws him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Welles tries to go towards Max, yanked back by the handcuffs, pulls the bed a few inches, but it's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he's got nothing to do with this... let him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you guess what I'm going to say next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know anything... he's got nothing to do with this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the film, or we kill him. Sorrow and rage rises up in Welles, but there's no choice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.  It's in a safe deposit box, in the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How cooperative.  Longdale will keep you company. Dino takes out HANDCUFF KEYS, throws them to Longdale. Longdale approaches Welles carefully, unlocking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let Longdale's questionable choice of weapon give you any ideas. If his fey little gun puts enough little holes in you, you'll be just as dead... and so will Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it, dirtbag... ! Eddie comes to SHOVE Welles.  Welles stumbles to the ground, gets to his feet.  Welles walks, takes one last glance back towards Max.  Longdale follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching them go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' car moves in the slow flow of traffic into mid-to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles is at the wheel.  Longdale is in the passenger sea gun held in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the middleman, am I right? Old man Christian wasn't about to go shopping for a snuff film himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't exactly have been possible for a man of his stature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he sent you, gave you the money, his errand-boy.  And if you refused, it wasn't like you could tell anyone your pervert boss just asked you to get him a snuff film.  That's the beauty of lawyer/client privilege.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's trust.  Mr. Christian trusted me implicitly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have paid you a lot, for you to risk everything.  Would've had to have cut yourself a real nice piece of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was well compensated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you got scared when Mrs. Christian hired me.  You knew about the film, figured it had to be in that safe.  How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind how I found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Followed me... must have freaked out when you saw me closing in on your buddies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're no friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except, you're willing commit murder with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this would be happening if you would have left it alone.  If you weren't digging up a girl who died six years ago.  A girl no one even remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne Mathews, that was her name.  Her mom remembers her. Welles looks at Longdale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found these smut dealers and asked to buy a snuff film, right? Wanted them to find you one.  Well, they didn't find you one, Longdale, they went out and made you one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne Mathews was alive till you paid money to have her murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth and drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it get him off, huh, watching them cut her up?  Tell me, because I really want to understand.  Did he jerk off to it?  You watch it with him, sit there giving him a handjob while you both watched... ? Longdale jams the gun against Welles' side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making me very angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me.  Tell me some more of the secrets you and Christian shared. What kind of degenerate pervert was he really?  What the fuck did he want with a snuff film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking me why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking. Longdale sits back, wipes sweat from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man like Mr. Christian, a great man... all his money, all his power... a man who attained everything there was to attain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he buy a film of some poor, lost girl getting butchered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it incredibly obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlighten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he could.  He did it because he could. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other reason were you looking for? Welles tightens his grip on the wheel, numbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles double parks, puts his hazard lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longdale sits forward, looks to the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got four minutes till I call Mr. Velvet and let him know there's a problem. Longdale takes a CELLULAR PHONE from his pocket, shows it Welles climbs out, heading to the bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles and the SAFE DEPOSIT MANAGER enter.  They go to pu their KEYS in one drawer, unlocking it a pulling it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I show you to a booth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've got it. Welles pulls the drawer open, takes the 8MM film out and hands the empty drawer to the manager, exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles comes out from the SAFE DEPOSIT VAULT, pocketing t film, crossing towards the entrance, looking around... ... at other CUSTOMERS waiting on line... ... at a GUARD with a GUN at his side... Welles detours, toward one of the LOAN DESKS.  The BANK EMPLOYEE behind the desk is occupied, on the phone. As Welles moves past the desk, he grabs a PAIR of SCISSOR from a pencil holder and palms it, heading to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles gets behind the wheel.  Longdale looks at his watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost went over your limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Welles puts the car in gear and drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get it when we get there. Longdale puts the gun to the side of Welles' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, shoot me.  Then try driving to Brooklyn with my brains all over the windshield. Welles keeps driving.  Longdale sits back, stewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked open.  Welles enters, takes the 8MM FI out and holds it in his hand.  Longdale follows. As Welles moves forward, his face goes slack... Machine is seated on the bed, Eddie and Dino stand smokin cigarettes, and further on, Max is tied to the target, slumped over, three arrows in his chest.  Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!! Welles runs towards Max, crying out, tears in his eyes... Machine rises, goes to intercept Welles, grabbing him. Welles tries to break free, but Machine lifts Welles up a throws him brutally to the ground. Welles scrambles to get up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuckers! Eddie comes to KICK Welles in the face. Welles is sent sprawling, blood gushing from his nose.  H lays there, stunned, weeping. Eddie pries the 8MM FILM from Welles' hand, tosses it... Dino catches the film. Machine comes to drag Welles towards the bed. Dino unspools the film, holding it up to examine it. Machine handcuffs Welles to the metal bedframe.  Welles falls to his knees, holding his face. Eddie PUNCHES Welles in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Eddie PUNCHES Welles in the kidney.  Welles tries to prot himself.  Eddie raises his fist to punch again, but Machi catches Eddie's fist, throws Eddie back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised him to Machine. Eddie looks up at Machine, who towers over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first.  You might want to watch this, Mr. Welles... Welles looks up through tears... Dino drops the 8MM FILM on the floor, takes a small bottl of lighter fluid from his pocket.  Longdale comes to watc Welles watches helpless, agonizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... please... Dino drops the film to the floor, sprays it with fluid, takes out matches, light one, drops it... The 8MM FILM goes up in flame... Welles watches, quaking, hysterical, trying to pull himse towards the flame, dragging the bed... The film is destroyed by flame... Welles gives up, presses his face to the floor, eyes shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so it ends.  It's as if she never existed. Welles falls back, gasping, wiping blood and tears and spittle from his face, getting slowly, to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame yourself.  You were in way over your head. He looks to Max's corpse, to the smoldering film... Swallowing back his fear, panic and rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers.  Small time, motherfuckers... !  Tell me something... Welles spits blood, hangs onto the bed for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why you did it, Dino, Eddie... but, why'd the lawyer do it?  Must have been a helluva lot of money, right?  One fuckload of money... Welles sits on the bed, eyes burning with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you all still doing small time, huh?  What are you still doing in the sewer, Eddie?! Christian gave Longdale a million dollars to find him a snuff film. How much did you ever see... ? Eddie and Dino look to Longdale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million dollars, Dino.  How much did he tell you he had... Longdale's getting very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him.  You think he played it square?  How much did he give you, how much did he keep for himself? Eddie walks towards Longdale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's he talking about? Longdale takes out his gun, aims it at Machine, Dino and Eddie, scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Longdale?  Did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sell us short, you fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back!  You have a gun, Eddie, show it to me.  Now! Eddie slowly takes out his gun, seething.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the ground, kick it here... Eddie puts the gun down, kicks it... Longdale picks it up, throws it far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking lawyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move back!  All of you... move! Machine, Dino and Eddie stand between Longdale and the ca with tinted windows parked across the warehouse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking? Welles watches as Machine, Dino and Eddie back slowly awa from Longdale.  Longdale's gun hand is shaky... Welles tries to drag himself towards the table where his and bullets are, dragging the bed, inch by inch... Longdale back away, trying to angle around the menacing t so he can get to the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off!  Everything's been taken care of, and I'm leaving now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere if you fucked us, lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the guts, tough guy?  Gonna kill us all, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betrayed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are! Machine edges forward, holding his hands in the air. Longdale brandishes the gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep back! Machine, Eddie and Dino are held at bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna live through this. Welles still tries to get to the table, wrist bleeding in the cuff, bed screeching across the floor... Machine, hands up, slowly reaches behind his shoulder, touches the handle of a huge KNIFE sheathed to his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our business is done, I'm leaving, no one's going to stop me... Longdale glances towards the car, seems like he's about t make a run for it.  Dino Velvet takes a step forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Machine unsheathes the KNIFE and THROWS... THUNK!  The knife imbeds to the hilt in Longdale's chest Longdale's gun FIRES... Dino Velvet flies backwards, shot in the face! Dino hits the ground, screaming, writhing, hands to his face, blood pouring out between his fingers. Longdale falls back onto his ass, sitting there, eyes bug out in surprise.  He looks down at the knife in his chest Machine lets out a SCREAM, runs to Dino... Machine falls to his knees and grips Dino, tries to hold him.  Dino's screaming, squirming frantically... Longdale sits looking down at the knife in his chest, loo up, and gallons of blood pour from his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Eddie comes to look down at the Longdale.  Longdale falls back, dead, blood still flowing from his maw. Welles drags the heavy bed, getting closer to the table.. Eddie spins, looks across to see Welles struggling... Dino breaks free from Machine, runs blindly, still holdin his gushing face, falls, tries to get back up... Eddie runs towards Welles. Dino stumbles forwards, writhing, then suddenly lays stil Machine rises, looking at Dino.  Tears come out from Machine's eyes and roll down his mask. One last gasp and shudder from Dino's body; death rattle. Welles pulls the bed, practically pulling his arm from th socket, desperately clawing towards the table... The table is mere feet away... Eddie arrives, KICK Welles in the ribs... Welles recoils.  Eddies KICKS again.  Welles curls into a ball.  Eddie KICKS again...

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Eddie stops, looks to Machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's mine! Machine strides over the Longdale's corpse, puts his foot Longdale's chest, yanks out the knife... Machine starts this way... Eddie backs from Welles.  Welles looks up, trying to shak off unconsciousness, sees Machine coming... Welles bows down, on his knees, as if to accept his fate. Reaching his free hand into his suit pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... please, don't kill me... please... ! Machine arrives, knife in hand, lifts Welles' head back b the hair, brings the knife hand back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do him good. Welles rises suddenly, arm shooting forward, STABBING SCISSORS deep in Machine stomach... Machine ROARS, falling back, pitching forward... Machine's knife clatters to the ground. Eddie's eyes go wide.  Machine hits the floor, clutching his guts. Welles pushes upwards with all he's got left, turns the i bedframe onto its side, flipping the mattress off... Eddie moves forward, furious... Welles grabs Machine's knife, wielding it, holding Eddie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Eddie... Welles drags the now lightened bed frame towards the tabl Eddie's sorely tempted, but keeps away. Eddie turns, looks across the warehouse... There's his gun, lying there, far away. Eddie runs for the gun. Welles pulls himself to the table, reaches for the gun, knocks the table over.  He's got the gun, but... Bullets hit the floor as the table falls. Welles struggles to open his gun with his sole free hand, gets it open, holds it between his knees... Welles grabs a bullet... Eddie's running toward his gun, gasping for air... Machine's on his knees, pulling the scissors out with trembling hands... Welles puts the bullet in the gun, flips it shut, rises, taking aim across the warehouse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop Eddie! Eddie's running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls back the hammer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to Christ I'll shoot you in the back... ! Eddie stops, hands up, about ten feet from his gun... Machine stays on his knees, holding his bleeding stomach. Welles points his gun at Machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back, or I put a hole in him. Eddie's looking at his gun, so close, so far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might make it to your gun, but not before I shoot Machine.  And if I have to shoot him because of you, and I don't kill him, right after he kills me, he's gonna kill you. Eddie turns, starts walking back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off the mask. Machine shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one bullet. Welles looks to see Eddie heading back, keeps the gun on Machine, backs away, dragging the bed frame, looks to the DOOR behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only choice you have now, is which one of us kills you. Welles backs away, drags the bedframe.  Eddie's getting close.  Welles points the gun at Eddie.  Eddie slows. Welles points the gun at Machine, points the gun at Eddie Welles puts the gun to the chain of his handcuffs, FIRES. breaks the handcuff chain. Welles bolts to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the gun! Eddie runs back towards his gun. Machine rises with a grunt of pain, moves towards the doo but agony doubles him back over to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles shoves out into daylight, fleeing down the stairs, running towards his car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles climbs in, gets out his keys, starts the car... He pulls away, TIRES SCREECHING.  Behind, Eddie gives cha running, FIRING his gun... Welles ducks as BULLETS SLAM the car, SHATTERING WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' car picks up speed, takes a turn, BURNING RUBBER. Behind, Eddie curses, runs back to the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles glances back, ENGINE ROARING.  He tries to keep fr crying, steers with one hand, holds his bleeding face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' car races away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy looks tired, like she hasn't slept.  She feeds Cindy. PHONE RINGS.  Amy goes to answer it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, it's me.  Listen very carefully..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom?  Where have you been... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles drives, face caked in dried blood, cellular phone his ear.  The HIGHWAY rushes past out the car window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, just listen.  Take Cindy and get out of the house.  Do it now. Go to a hotel and stay there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?  Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.  Please, honey, I can't explain.  Don't use the phone, just pack a bag and get out.  I'm on my way.  I'll be back at the house in three hours.  Call me from the hotel when you get there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, Amy, please, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy hangs up, scared.  She goes to grab Cindy up into her arms, hurrying out of the kitchen and going upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' car tears down the freeway, passing other cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suburban streets.  Welles' car arrives, parks.  Welles ge out, starts across a neighbor's yard, cuts between houses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles enters his backyard, slowing, taking out his gun. keeps behind shrubbery, surveying his dark house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles uses a key to unlock the SLIDING GLASS DOOR, opens slow, enters, gun up, searching the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles pushes the door open, checks this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles makes sure the bedroom's empty, looks in the bathroom.  He puts his gun away, leaves the lights off. He goes to the PHONE on the bedside table, unscrews the earpiece.  He removes a small, wire-mesh BUGGING DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Welles picks up the cordless phone, struggles to p the receiver open.  He discovers another small BUG. He drops the BUGS to the floor, crushes them under foot. He puts the phone back together and is replacing it when RINGS LOUDLY.  Welles is startled, drops the phone... Welles takes a breath, trying to shake off the jitters. picks up the RINGING PHONE, answers it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. Welles stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like getting home after a rough day.  Home sweet home. Welles moves into the HALL, towards the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away.  Pack your bags, put the wife and kid in the car and find a place to hide.  If you're lucky, you'll never see me again. Welles takes out his gun, opens the front door, looking o The street in front of the house is empty.  CRICKETS CHIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.  I know where you live.  I know everything I need to know to find you. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I? MACHINE is HEARD HANGING UP the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's crying.  Amy opens the door with the chain on, se Welles, lets him in.  Amy and Welles embrace, kissing.  A touches Welles damaged face, worried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, honey, I'm okay.  Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Tom?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you, Amy.  You know I can't.  You have to trust me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be this way for now.  It won't be long. Welles goes to pick up Cindy, tries to comfort her, kisse her red face as she keeps crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you called?  Why don't you answer your phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gate 32B. Welles accepts the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Empire State Building in the distance says NYC, and a CAMERA PAN DOWN says another seedy MOTEL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles sits at a small desk, looking through a PHONE BOOK white pages, finds... "HOSPITALS." Welles picks up the PHONE, chooses a number, dials it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, can you connect me with the duty nurse? (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Lieutenant Anderson down here in the Thirteenth Precinct.  I've got a helluva problem I was hoping you could give me a hand with.  We had a stabbing incident a couple of days ago, and it looks like the supposed victim gave us a false name and address. Can you tell me if you had an adult male with an abdominal wound in you ER in the last forty-eight hours? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd remember this guy; a body- builder, real big guy, five foot eleven, with acne all over his chest and back... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, thanks for your help.  Welles hangs up, uses a pen to cross out a number in the phone book, starts dialing the next number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles lies on the bed, on the phone, rubbing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... guy sticks out like a sore thumb.  Five foot ten or eleven, body-builder, bad acne... (listen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks anyway. Welles gets up, hangs up, brings the phone back to the de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE BOOK'S open on the desk with nearly a hundred hospital phone numbers crossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... abdominal wound.  You'd know him if you saw him...  Light cuts into the room from between the curtains.  Well paces, carrying the phone with him, weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a body-builder, stands just under six feet... Welles stops in his track, listening, suddenly attentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... covered in acne. That's him, that's the guy.  Listen, we, uh... we think he filed a bogus report on this stabbing, gave us a false name and address... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'll hold. Welles goes to the desk, takes out his notepad.  He start feeling his pockets for his pen, can't find it, telephone book, searching, looks under the desk... Welles ducks under the desk to grab the pen off the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... yes. (sits, writing in pad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher Higgins.  Thirty- fifteen, Thirty Fifth Street. Where?  Astoria, Queens. Welles is scribbling all this down in his notepad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A relatively quiet residential street.  HOMES are small, story affairs, close together, each very much like its neighbor, some with tiny yards fenced in by brick walls. Welles' Ford comes slowly down the street.  CHILDREN in school uniforms are heading off for the day in groups. Welles parallel parks.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Welles turns off the engine. He's watching a HOUSE on the other side of the street.  T house is brick on the bottom, aluminum siding on top, quaint, with brick staircase from the front door down to GARAGE underneath, plastic PINK FLAMINGOS on the small la Cars pass in the street.  Welles watches school children pass on the near sidewalk.  He slumps down a little in hi seat, adjusting the rearview mirror, adjusting his side mirror, rolling up the window. Welles takes a cautionary look around, takes out his gun, pours bullets out and pockets them.  He picks up a PAPER off the passenger seat and opens it. He takes out a long, thin metal FILE, pulling off the shr wrap packaging, feels the file with his thumb. Keeping his open gun low under the steering wheel, Welles slides the file into the barrel, scraping gently all alon the gun's inner barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles sits smoking a cigarette, watching the quaint hous He looks in his side mirror... There's a large CAR coming down the block with its turn signal on.  Welles slumps a little lower. The car passes, slowing.  The GARAGE DOOR of the quaint house begins to open.  Welles watches... Can't really see the driver of the car except for the bac of his head, but he's huge.  It's a good bet it's Machine Beside him in the passenger seat is a GREY HAIRED OLD WOM The car pulls into the darkness of the quaint house's garage.  After a moment, the OLD WOMAN comes from the garage, walks with a cane, wears glasses.  She goes to th sidewalk, checks her MAILBOX, finds it empty. Welles watches. The old woman goes back to the garage.  She goes inside. The garage door closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles still watches the house.  There's a light on in on of the second floor windows, curtains closed. Welles yawns, shaking his head, trying to stay awake. At the quaint house, a light comes on in the front pictur window.  Looks like a living room or dining room.  The ol woman comes to sit at a table. Welles takes binoculars off the front seat...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The old woman says something to someone we cannot see. She's at the dinner table, with a place setting in front her.  After a moment, someone joins her... It's Machine, you can tell by his bulk, by his huge forearms.  The lacy curtains of the window block part of view, so we never see his face.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Welles lowers the binoculars, still watching. Through the window across the street, Machine can be seen putting a plate of food in front of the old woman.  The o woman smiles up at him, says something. Machine goes to light two candles on the table with match then goes back to stand beside the old woman. Machine is seen from behind, bends to give the old woman kiss on the cheek, then leaves the room.  The old woman starts to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn light is just breaking.  Welles has fallen asleep, slumped low behind the wheel, snoring lightly. Welles awakens with a start, looking around, confused.  H calms, rubbing his eyes, wiping sweat from his features.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: The quaint house's garage door begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Welles sees this, keeps low, watching... The big car backs out into the street.  The old woman's behind the wheel, wearing a hat, driving away, alone. Welles watches the car head away in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Welles gets out of his car, shuts the door quietly behind him.  He starts walking towards the quaint house, looks a directions, making sure no one's around. Ahead, the garage door begins to close. Welles picks up the pace, trying not to look too conspicuous.  The garage door's halfway down... Welles runs towards the garage, has to dive and roll to g there, but he makes it under the door just as it closes.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: In ONE WINDOW of the quaint house, an eyeball is peering from lacy curtains, then moves away and curtains fall shu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles gets up, takes out his gun, brushing off. The garage is dark, full of BOXES and JUNK.  Welles moves towards the door to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine, in T-shirt and jeans, seen only from behind, com to a DRESSER and opens a bottom drawer.  His huge hands p clothing aside, digging deep to the bottom of the drawer, taking out the WRESTLING MASK. Machine stands straight, pulling the mask down over his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles enters from the garage, gun up.  The dank basement small.  A PILE of LAUNDRY lies on the floor near a WASHIN

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE.
dialogues.text: SHEETS hang off several CLOTHES LINES strung across two metal poles.  Welles leads with his gun... He moves around the sheets, looking behind them.  There's WOODEN STAIRCASE leading upstairs.  Welles starts up, treading lightly, trying not to make a sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles slowly opens the door to the kitchen, pointing his gun.  No one here.  The decor is feminine, neat and tidy. It's grandma's house, and it shows, with gaudy PRINT WALLPAPER everywhere, every shelf displaying HUMMEL FIGURINES or COLLECTORS PLATES.  Very Home Shopping Netwo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles slowly opens the swinging door, entering from the kitchen, sweeping the room with his gun.  No sign of Machine.  The whole house is dead quiet. He passes the dining room TABLE where he watched the old woman eat last night... passes fake PAINTINGS on the wall of waterfalls and sunset mountain landscapes... moves int the living room area... Yellow shag CARPET.  A pink SOFA is covered in clear plastic, facing an old TELEVISION in faux-wooden cabinet. Welles heads for a staircase leading to the second floor. Welles creeps up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles comes up from the stairs, arrives at a closed DOOR He opens the door.  It's a linen closet, with TOWELS and SHEETS on shelves, and a shelf of MEDICINE. Welles shuts the door and moves on.  There are TWO DOORS ahead, both closed.  Welles takes the one to the right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles pushes the door in, enters warily.  There's a constant SCRATCHING HEARD.  The room is like a child's, except the BED is huge.  Shelves are full of BOARDGAMES a COMIC BOOKS.  A DANZIG POSTER on the wall.  There's a REC PLAYER with LP RECORDS beside it.  A record turns on the turntable, the needle caught at the center, SCRATCHING... Welles eases his way over to the closet... reaching... Pulls it open, steps back, gun up.  Nothing.  Just clothi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles crosses, opens the door across the hall, enters... DOWN THE HALL, very slowly, Machine's head rises on the stairs, in the garish wrestling mask, peering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles stays near the door, looks around.  There's a fuzz sky-blue COMFORTER on the bed, fuzzy blue SLIPPERS nearby Lots of bottles of MEDICINE on the bedside table. Welles lowers his gun, takes a step back, into the hall..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles turns... Machine charges down the hall, screaming with rage, BOWIE KNIFE raised to kill... Welles brings his gun up, but Machine's upon him, stabbin Welles catches Machine's hand, stops the knife.  Machine grips Welles' gun hand, shoving him back... Welles is SLAMMED against the wall, grappling, gun hand pinned.  Welles GUN GOES OFF, once... twice... BLOWING HOLES in the ceiling.  Machine's grunts, pushing knife forward... closer to Welles, face... closer... Welles struggles, overpowered.  The tip of the horrible knife is inches away... Welles bends his knees, crouching, trying to gain distanc from the blade... Machine pulls Welles gun hand lower, brings it against th swinging LAUNDRY CHUTE DOOR built into the wall, begins twisting Welles' hand back, trying to pry the gun loose.. Welles looks out the corner of his eyes to his gun... Welles turns his gun hand, slowing struggling to aim the towards the knife, but it's awful close to his face... The knife's shaking, less than an inch from Welles' cheek Welles shuts his eyes and turns his head, letting out a C FIRES his gun... The bullet BLASTS Machine's knife, knocks it away! Machine recoils for a millisecond, but brings his now fre hand to Welles' throat, choking him.  Welles' face redden bleeding from bullet fragments... Welles tries to pry Machine's fingers from his throat. Machine works on Welles' gun hand with violent, renewed effort -- SLAMS Welles' hand against the laundry chute... SLAMS it... SLAMS it... till Welles DROPS the GUN... The gun can be HEARD CLATTERING down the chute.  Machine brings his hand to join the other around Welles' throat.  Welles can't break the grip... Welles PUNCHES Machine's face, till blood runs out from t mask's nose hole, but it's having no effect... Welles brings his KNEE UP HARD -- into Machine's stomach! Machine falls to his knees with a ROAR, holds his already wounded stomach, bleeding through his shirt... Welles falls, clutching his throat, gasping.  He struggle to his feet, leaps past, headlong towards the stairs... Machine rises, charging after...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Welles is TACKLED from behind... Welles and Machine TUMBLE down the stairs, SMASHING the wooden railing, toppling a BOOKSHELF... LANDING HARD... Welles PUNCHES and KICKS, breaking free, running across t living room.  Machine rises to give chase... Welles grabs a dining room CHAIR and THROWS it... Machine knocks the chair aside, keeps coming.  Welles gri another chair, uses it to hold Machine off... Machine grips the chair by the legs.  Welles SHOVES forwa pushes Machine back, letting go... Welles dives under the dining table, crawling on his hand and knees, scrambling... Machine throws the chair, runs, leaps... Machine lands on the table, crawls to the far edge, GRABB down with his meaty fists as Welles moves forward... Under the table, Welles jerks back, avoiding, then rises, extending his knees, PUSHING upwards from underneath... Welles FLIPS the table, throwing Machine to the floor... Welles charges towards the kitchen door, falls, gets up.. Machine gets to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Welles SHOVES through the swinging door... Machine BURSTS through, catching Welles, TACKLING him... Welles hits the floor with Machine on top.  Machine begin to rein PUNCHES down on Welles, head and back... Welles tries to cover up, taking a real beating... Machine rises, gripping Welles, LIFTING him, THROWS him.. Welles SMASHES into shelves of knick-knacks over the kitc sink, SHATTERING a WINDOW, landing on the sink and counte Machine comes to grip Welles again, drags him across the counter, KNOCKING EVERYTHING to the floor... Machine SWINGS Welles, releases him... Welles SLAMS the refrigerator and slumps to the ground, tries to stay conscious, trying weakly to get back up... Machine comes to Welles, gets on his knees... Machine wraps his arm around Welles' neck from behind, ge him in a CHOKE HOLD, tightens his grip, cutting off Welle airway with his forearm... Welles tries to break Machine's impossible grip with one hand, begins searching the floor with his other hand... frantically feeling for anything he can use... Welles' face is blood red... Welles' hand grasps desperately... finds a FORK, grips it Welles SWINGS the fork back, STABS it into Machine's thig Machine SCREAMS, releases Welles and falls back, reaching around to the fork... Welles gets to his knees, sucking air, turns to look... Machine crawls away, pulls the fork out with trembling fingers.  Beyond him, there's the BASEMENT DOOR. Welles gets to his feet, looking... He grabs a FRYING PAN off the counter, gripping it in bot hands and moving towards Machine... Machine's getting up... Welles BASHES Machine in the face with an upward swing of the frying pan... Machine is sent backpedaling, CRASHING into the oven! Welles drops the pan, leaps over Machine, to the door...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Welles comes down the stairs, falls when he gets to the bottom, barely has any strength left.  He looks all directions, sees the LAUNDRY CHUTE in the ceiling... Welles gets up, stumbling, falls to his knees at the PILE dirty LAUNDRY, starts digging through it, searching desperately, throwing clothing aside... Behind, Machine comes down the stairs, a bloody mess... Welles searches the laundry pile...  Machine reaches the bottom of the stairs, heading for Welles.  Welles turns, has the GUN in hand, FIRES TWICE.. HITTING Machine in the shoulder and stomach, knocking Machine a few steps backwards... Welles FIRES... Machine's HIT in the CHEST, falling back, into hanging laundry, pulling down the clothes line and sheets... Machine hits the ground, wrapped in sheets. Welles stands, still aiming the gun, pulls the trigger on empty chamber.  Out of bullets. Machine's trying to pull free from the sheets, trying to back up to his feet.  Welles lets out a sob, drops the gu walking to Machine... Welles climbs onto Machine from behind, takes clothing li in hand, starts wrapping the cord around Machine's throat Welles pulls back on the clothes line, pulling it tight.. Machine tries to get his fingers around the cord.  Welles stands, pulling tighter, putting a foot on Machine's back pulling the clothes line with all his might... The cord's cutting into Welles' hand, drawing blood. Machine, face down, lets out a gurgling sound, struggling struggling... till he finally stops moving. Welles releases the cord, takes a step back, breathing ha trembling.  He looks around the basement. Welles walks to pick up his gun, replaces the gun in his holster.  He stands looking at Machine. Welles walks to Machine, bends, grasps Machine wrestling mask, pulling it off.  He rolls Machine over... Welles stares down at Machine.  We never see Machine's fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles comes up from the basement, slow, hurting.  He loo around at the damage done, looks down to see he's still holding Machine's mask.  He drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles crosses the street, going to his car.  He gets int his car, starts it, pulls out and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRDS SING.  KIDS are kicking around a soccer ball down t street.  Welles' Ford arrives, pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles comes in the front door, still a horrible mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!  Amy? He waits.  The house is quiet.  No one home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk.  A CAR comes down the street, slows...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Amy sits forward, seeing Welles' car in the driveway. Cindy's in a child safety seat in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy comes in the front door, carrying Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom?! No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any pushes the bedroom door open and looks in.  Welles is asleep on the bed, still in his clothing and shoes.  Amy watches him sleep, sad. Amy backs out of the room, pulls the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Welles sleeps, still in bloody clothing.  He's restless, shifting, MUTTERING under his breath.  Bad drea Welles suddenly sits bolt upright in the bed, looking aro the dark room, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's in her high-chair by the table.  Amy's at the KITCHEN SINK, washing vegetables, peeling potatoes. Welles comes to stand in the doorway behind her.  Amy tur to look at him.  It breaks her heart to see him so wounde but she forces herself to continue working in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much forgiveness do you think I have in me? Welles comes into the kitchen, stands beside Cindy, puts hand out and clasp's Cindy's tiny hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk about it yet... not yet. Amy keeps peeling potatoes, refuses to look at him.  Well looks down at Cindy, pats Cindy's head, looks back at Amy He stands looking at Amy for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles wears his fishing cap, pushing his lawn mower, mow his yard.  He has done some healing, though his face is still swollen and terribly bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles feeds Cindy with one hand, eating his own dinner w the other.  Amy's across the table, eating, watching them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles works on the WATER HEATER, wrench in hand, reading instruction sheet.  He puts the sheet aside, uses the wre to begin loosening one of the pipe fittings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles drags two GARBAGE CANS from the garage to the stre leaving them by the mailbox, walking back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles and Amy are in bed.  Amy's asleep, on her side, facing away from Welles.  Welles lays awake, on his back, staring up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles pushes a cart down one aisle.  He looks at his LIS takes a BOX of CEREAL off one shelf, puts it in the cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles waits in line with his cart.  It's a long line. He takes out his wallet, opens it. In the fold of the wallet, there's a PHOTO folded into quarters.  Welles unfolds it and looks at it dolefully. It's the PHOTO of Mary Anne Mathews, the image Welles printed from early in the snuff film.  Sad girl.  Welles folds in back up, puts it in another pocket.  He looks forward in the line to see if it's moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles transfers BAGS of GROCERIES from the shopping cart into the back seat of his Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles drives on the HIGHWAY, groceries in back.  He watc the roadway ahead.  There's little traffic. Welles glances down, turns on the RADIO.  Some CLASSICAL MUSIC PLAYS.  Welles stares forward through the windshiel After a moment, Welles turns the RADIO OFF.  He drives. ONLY SOUND is the DRONE of the ENGINE and TIRES. Welles is suddenly overwhelmed by emotion, eyes filling w tears.  He tries to fight it, but can't help himself.  Hi face contorts with sorrow and he cannot stop crying, lett out a loud WAIL of misery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles' car moves to the shoulder, brakes to a sudden HAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles takes great deep breathes and lets them out, over over again, wiping at his tears.  He lets out a little hi pitched WHINE from far back in his throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... why... ? He's wracked by SOBBING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's in a chair, reading a BOOK, not far from Cindy's cr Cindy's asleep.  The FRONT DOOR of the house is HEARD OPENING and CLOSING from far off in the house.  Amy looks momentarily, then returns to reading. FOOTSTEPS can be HEARD coming through the house, getting CLOSER.  Amy looks up from her book.  The bedroom door's open a crack.  The door slowly pushes open.  Welles stand there, eyes red from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom... ? Welles comes into the room, stands before Amy.  He gets t his knees, puts his head in Amy's lap, wraps his arms aro her waist.  Amy holds him, worried, eyes filling with tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you... I have to tell you what happened.  I have to tell you everything, but we can't tell anyone else.  No one else can ever know. Amy runs her fingers through his hair, bends down to rest her head on his back, holding him with her eyes closed. Welles holds tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all I've got.  You're all I've ever had. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one who can save me. the end

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
